## Major Initiatives and Projects

### Data and Analytics Platforms

- **Humanitarian Data Insights Platform (HDIP)**
  - Launched: Public beta December 10, 2024
  - Partners: DataKind, Save the Children, Microsoft
  - Technology: Uses generative AI to streamline data accessibility and predict metadata
  - Source: https://www.datakind.org/2024/08/06/humanitarian-data-insights-project-using-generative-ai-to-streamline-data-access-and-use-for-humanitarian-action/

- **DISHA (Data Insights for Social and Humanitarian Action)**
  - Organization: UN Global Pulse partnership
  - Technology: AI-powered platform using mobile phone, satellite, and digital transaction data
  - Application: Real-time displacement patterns and disaster damage tracking

### Organizational AI Strategies

- **UNICEF Venture Fund**. "Trends and Future Outlook for Generative AI: Access, Inclusion, and Advancing the SDGs." Available at: https://www.unicefventurefund.org/story/generative-ai-and-future-access-inclusion-and-humanitarian-action
  - Note: UNICEF finalized internal AI strategy in 2024/2025

- **Danish Refugee Council (DRC)**
  - Developed four AI-powered forecast models analyzing 120+ indicators to predict displacement

- **Build Change**
  - Exploring generative AI for multilingual, hyper-localized reconstruction and home fortification guidance

### Funding Initiatives

- **Google.org**: $30 million open call for Generative AI Accelerator program (6-month program)
  - Deadline: February 10, 2025
  - Focus: AI-driven solutions for community resilience and humanitarian challenges

- **Elrha**. "AI for Humanitarians: Shaping future innovation." 2024
  - Supported cohort of humanitarian practitioners through 6-month guided learning journey
  - Source: https://www.elrha.org/funding-opportunities/ai-for-humanitarians-shaping-future-innovation

## Volunteer Organizations and Community Initiatives

### Organizations Mobilizing AI Volunteers

- **AI For Mankind** (501(c)(3) nonprofit)
  - Mission: Mobilize tech community for world-challenging problems using AI and Data
  - Seeking: Web developers, mobile developers, UI/UX, data scientists, AI experts
  - Website: https://aiformankind.org/

- **AI for Good Foundation**
  - Focus: AI/ML development for social and ecological impact
  - Alignment: UN Sustainable Development Goals
  - Website: https://ai4good.org/get-involved/volunteer/

- **Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team (HOT)**
  - Community: Thousands of dedicated volunteers
  - Initiative: fAIr (AI-assisted mapping) - empowers humanitarian mappers to create localized AI models
  - Focus: Priority countries for humanitarian response
  - Website: https://www.hotosm.org/

- **AI Asia Pacific Institute (AIAPI)**
  - Focus: Responsible AI development in Asia-Pacific region
  - Website: https://aiasiapacific.org/get-involved/volunteer/

## Key Statistics and Findings

### Workforce Trends

- **Tokyo University Study**: 97% of students reported using GPT for coursework, indicating a new generation of aid workers familiar with AI tools

### Applications

- **Advocacy and Communication**: ChatGPT used for drafting social media posts, media releases, and articles
- **Data Analysis**: AI enables analysis of vast datasets to predict trends and inform humanitarian response
- **Predictive Analytics**: Shift from reactive to anticipatory humanitarian action
- **Legal Analysis**: Bespoke generative AI instances to query refugee law and understand protection needs

### Challenges and Risks

- **Data Privacy**: ChatGPT privacy statement indicates staff read and record information to improve algorithms
  - Risk: Humanitarians must avoid inputting sensitive operational data or personally identifiable information
- **Algorithmic Bias**: Poor data quality and biased algorithms can lead to unfair outcomes
- **Equity Concerns**: Potential to exacerbate vulnerabilities and inequalities
